primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The restoration of human personhood through the structural and individual removal of oppression.

tekstueel_bewijs: Social change which removes the yoke of injustice... aims at the rehumanization of the victim.
Social change gives the oppressor a chance to return to the whole ground of his being.
The rehumanization of human beings is the goal of social change.
Christian faith believes to be of infinite worth.
It was he who commanded humankind to have dominion over the earth.
liberates and rehumanizes the offender, also.
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies with the Subject (agent of change) or the Receiver (beneficiary).

helper.identificatie: Reservoir of courage / Wellsprings of faith
tekstueel_bewijs: out of the depth of their own reservoir of courage and wellsprings of faith refuse to accept...
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Sender (origin) but not the active Subject of the change.

tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is primarily horizontal (societal structures and human attitudes) rather than vertical (sin against God/Satan).

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The individual refusal to accept oppression (The 'Epic of Courage').
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Oppressed People
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The internal psychological change parallels the external social change.

voorbeelden_god_subject: he chose to fashion his sons and daughters.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: The person who cooperates... seeks to dehumanize.
Social change gives the oppressor a chance.

voorbeelden: Such a person must rob the oppressed.
To affirm our oneness is to see again what God first saw.
all manner of outrages can be practiced.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes the obligation to change and the inherent capacity of the human spirit to resist, rather than a divine endowment of power.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Oppression) to ~S2 (Social Change) to S1 (Rehumanization).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is achieved through human social action that aligns with God's original creative intent.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: S2 is treated as a social/psychological tragedy rather than an ontological or spiritual death.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While theologically grounded in the 'Imago Dei', the engine of the sermon is anthropocentric. Social change is the subject that heals; God is the background validator.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: the goal of social change for the Christian is to honor God.
Such social change in a very real sense means the healing of the brokenhearted.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God for the creation in diversity in which he chose to fashion his sons and daughters.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The ancestors and the 'militant old sorrow song' singers are used as models of internal resistance.
bijbelse_figuren_als_model: Zacchaeus (as an example of an offender gladdened by change)
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Christ as the one who descends into the dehumanization of the cross to rehumanize us by His resurrection.

identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Salvation is equated with social progress and psychological resilience.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: Highly coherent as a social manifesto, but theologically the 'Second Adam' is mentioned without narrative function.
spanning_punten: The use of Luke 4:18 (Christ's mission) is attributed to 'Social Change' as the subject.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Social change gives the oppressor a chance to return to the whole ground of his being.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The 'reservoir of courage' is presented as an inherent human quality.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is seen as 'diseased minds' and 'labels', primarily a social and psychological dysfunction.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon functions as a call to action where 'Social Change' performs the roles traditionally reserved for the Holy Spirit.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: Social change is the active subject of healing and liberation.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Position Christ as the Subject who brings social change through His reign.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'Social change heals the brokenhearted', use 'Christ heals the brokenhearted by breaking the power of injustice through us.'

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: Hearer as the hero/agent of rehumanization.
identificatie_herstel.voorgestelde_identificatie: Hearer as the 'bruised' who is set at liberty by an external Savior.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Emphasize human inability to 'drain the poison of racism' without divine intervention.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Focus on how the 'Second Adam' provides the power (Pouvoir) that the 'First Adam' lost.

tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Identify the 'Opponent' as a spiritual power that human 'social change' alone cannot defeat.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: To make the need for a Divine Subject (Grace) necessary.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.probleem: Ethics (Social Change) has replaced Soteriology (God's act).
narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: 1. God rehumanizes us in Christ. 2. Therefore, we seek social change.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon has a powerful ethical core and a noble vision of human dignity, but it risks turning the Gospel into a 'do-it-yourself' project of social engineering.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorically, this is a powerful civil rights speech; actantially, it is a Pelagian narrative where man saves man.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis of Luke 4 is present but the actantial Subject is switched from 'The Spirit of the Lord' to 'Social Change'.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that 'Social Change' is functioning as a 'Pseudo-God' actant in this text.

appendices.notities: The sermon is a classic example of the 'Social Gospel' where the actantial roles of the Trinity are transferred to sociological processes.
